question.body: What is the contribution of the first cell (pierced females) to the chi-square test statistic?

response.feedback: Incorrect. It seems like you divided the numerator, (observed-expected) squared, by the observed count rather than by the expected count.
Correct. Indeed, the contribution of the first cell is: (click here to see the equation).
Incorrect. It seems like you divided the numerator, (observed-expected) squared, by the table count (1,000) rather than by the expected count of the cell.
Incorrect. It seems like you divided the numerator, (observed-expected) squared, by the column total (648) rather than by the expected count of the cell.
Incorrect. It seems like you divided the numerator, (observed-expected) squared, by the row total (640) rather than by the expected count of the cell.
